bill.title: Controlled Substances
bill.description: Updates chapter 329, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to make it consistent with federal laws on controlled substances. (HB2600 HD2)

history.action: (H) Pending introduction.
(H) Introduced and Pass First Reading.
(H) Referred to PBM/HLT, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 7
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by PBM/HLT on Thursday, 02-02-12 11:15AM in House conference room 309.

(H) The committees on PBM recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 9 Ayes: Representative(s) Aquino, Cullen, Ichiyama, M. Lee, Luke, Takai, Yamashita, Fontaine, Johanson; Ayes with reservations: none; 1 Noes: Representative(s) Souki; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Saiki, Takumi.

(H) The committees on HLT recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 8 Ayes: Representative(s) Yamane, Morikawa, Jordan; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) C. Lee, Mizuno, Wooley, Ching, Pine; 1 Noes: Representative(s) Hanohano; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Belatti.
(H) Reported from PBM/HLT (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 226-12), recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.

(H) Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with Representative(s) Wooley voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Hanohano voting no (1) and Representative(s) Belatti, C. Lee, M. Lee, Souki excused (4).
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Tuesday, 02-14-12 2:05PM in House conference room 325.

(H) The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 11 Ayes: Representative(s) Keith-Agaran, Rhoads, Brower, Cabanilla, Ito, Luke, Souki, Tsuji, Fontaine, Marumoto, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: none; 1 Noes: Representative(s) Herkes; and 3 Excused: Representative(s) Carroll, Coffman, McKelvey.
(H) Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 640-12) as amended in HD 1, recommending referral to FIN.
(H) Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Herkes, Kawakami, M. Lee, Mizuno, Morikawa excused (5).
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Thursday, 02-23-12 11:00AM in House conference room 308.
(H) Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org

(H) The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 17 Ayes: Representative(s) Oshiro, M. Lee, Choy, Cullen, Giugni, Hashem, Ichiyama, Jordan, Kawakami, C. Lee, Morikawa, Tokioka, Yamashita, Marumoto, Riviere; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Har, Ward; Noes: none; and Excused: none.
(H) Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 739-12) as amended in HD 2, recommending passage on Third Reading.
(H) Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday, 03-06-12.
(H) Passed Third Reading as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Hanohano voting no (1) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
(S) Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 261).
(S) Passed First Reading.
(S) Referred to HTH/PGM.
(S) The committee(s) on HTH/PGM has scheduled a public hearing on 03-21-12 3:00PM in conference room 229.

(S) The committee(s) on PGM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in PGM were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Espero, Baker, Ryan; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Kidani, Slom.

(S) The committee(s) on HTH recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in HTH were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Green, Nishihara, Baker, Wakai; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) Chun Oakland, Shimabukuro, Slom.
(S) Reported from HTH/PGM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3028) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Second Reading.
(S) One Day Notice 04-02-12.
(S) Passed Third Reading. Ayes, 23; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 2 (Shimabukuro, Solomon). Transmitted to House.
(H) Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 450).
(H) Transmitted to Governor.
